item.title: Hydrogen Combustion Engine
item.description: What is a Hydrogen Combustion Engine? A hydrogen combustion engine is a type of internal combustion engine that uses hydrogen as its primary fuel source. Unlike traditional gasoline or diesel engines, which rely on fossil fuels, hydrogen engines use hydrogen gas to power the combustion process. Hydrogen combustion engines work by mixing hydrogen gas with air inside a combustion chamber. The resulting mixture is then ignited, causing the hydrogen to combust and release energy in the form of heat.
